alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Weld and east central Larimer Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado near Greeley, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greeley, eastern Loveland, Windsor, Evans, Johnstown, Milliken, Berthoud, Eaton, Severance, LaSalle, Ault, Kersey, Timnath, Gill, Barnesville and Lucerne. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
